availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine Sewell. Father of Walter Sewell, Louis W. Sewell, Thomas Sewell, George W. Sewell, Sanford Sewell, Henry Sewell, and Amanda Sewell. Farmer in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 401A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 579.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 313.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 180B.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Sewell (1793-1882)," Memorial #87515681, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87515681 (accessed November 9, 2020).
